Comment: To be clear, they are urging conversion therapy. Depending on how Skrmetti turns out in the Supreme Court, I expect a national ban by the end of the year, with adults next on the list.
Author: WorthyAngle

Comment: Misleading headline as usual.   Part of "gender-affirming care" IS therapy.  As in, talking to a professional in social services, with understanding of psychology and related fields, to  sort out your thoughts, feelings, emotions, and navigate through the labyrinth of your own mind, past experiences, present concerns, future aspirations.   What's being proposed isn't therapy, but torture.   Make people feel guilty about their thoughts.  Convince them they're in a phase.   Try to force them into being someone they aren't, "for their own good."   Shame them punish them, molest them into conformance  and call it an exposure exercise.   This is what conversion therapy is.  It focuses on  achieving the predetermined outcome.  Actual Therapy is about the recipient's journey, and the road they travel upon, freshly paving it, patching over the potholes, making it a smoother ride
Author: GaimeGuy

Comment: They cited the Cass Review like 150 times and that report has been THOROUGHLY debunked by credible medical experts. The Cass Review was put together by members of the DeSantis administration for the sole purpose of banning gender affirming care for youths in the UK. It was very successful, leading to restrictions on care for adults, the banning of all care for youths, the banning of trans people from facilities that align with their gender identities (bathrooms, shelters, etc.) and now mandatory autism+ADHD tests for any youth seeking gender affirming care in the UK.   These reports are full of lies and demonstrably false medical claims. They don't consult with anyone who has ever treated a trans person. They're not valid medical stances but they're going to be used to restrict care and rights for ALL trans people of any age.   If you were on the fence or one of the Dems saying "well...the sports thing makes me uncomfortable", just know that this is the end result of telling trans people to concede some of our rights. We will lose EVERYTHING.
Author: Penguin_Sushi

Author: Citizen_Lunkhead

Comment: "If you were on the fence or one of the Dems saying "well...the sports thing makes me uncomfortable", just know that this is the end result of telling trans people to concede some of our rights."  And yet "the sports thing" does seem quite unfair to cis women and the numbers bear that out.  When did competing against cis women become a 'right'?  If someone demands all or nothing, most of the time they end up with nothing.  Militancy is its own worst enemy.  The "sports thing" - example:  Lia Thomas, swimmer  In the 2018–2019 season: competing in the men's team, ranked 554th in the 200 freestyle, 65th in the 500 freestyle, and 32nd in the 1650 freestyle.  In the 2021–2022 season: competing in the women's team, fifth in the 200 freestyle, first in the 500 freestyle, and eighth in the 1,650 freestyle. Thomas was ranked 89th among male college swimmers for that season.  500m: 65^(th)  ⇒ 1^(st) / 200m: 554^(th)   ⇒  5^(th)  / 1650m: 32^(nd)  ⇒ 8^(th)  Rank: 89^(th)  ⇒ 36^(th)  By the conclusion of Thomas's swimming career at UPenn in 2022, her rank had moved from 65th on the men's team to 1st on the women's team in the 500-yard freestyle, and 554th on the men's team to fifth on the women's team in the 200-yard freestyle. Thomas was ranked 36th among female college swimmers in the United States for the 2021–2022 season, and 46th among women swimmers nationally.
Author: nogooduse
